comments.body:
@dbczumar this is currently being tested in test_fluent_autolog.py 

[example: ](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/bec8c2c60786ea997f6d36d2d7c5867ef1d0f8ad/tests/tracking/fluent/test_fluent_autolog.py#L162)
```
mlflow.autolog(disable=True)
 assert autologging_is_disabled(mlflow.spark.FLAVOR_NAME)
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +351,355 @@            # needs to be called with disable=True. So do not short circuit and let
            # `mlflow.autolog()` invoke all active integrations with disable=True.
            if name != "mlflow" and get_autologging_config(name, "disable", True):
                revert_patches(name)
                return
